source.title: Opinion: Ask your doctor if the World Series is right for you ...

facts: The author and their family watch post-season baseball.
Advertisements for prescription drugs are prevalent during the World Series broadcasts, often showing people engaging in various activities despite having health issues like psoriasis or arthritis.
Drug companies spent $895.8 million on advertising last year alone within sports programming.
The FDA allows prescription drug ads as long as they include dual-modality risk statements about possible side effects.

neutral.headline: Watching the World Series: The Prevalence of Prescription Drug Advertisements
neutral.body_html: The author and their family enjoy watching post-season baseball, during which they encounter numerous advertisements for prescription drugs. These ads often depict individuals with health conditions like psoriasis or arthritis engaging in various activities despite these issues.

conservative.headline: Prescription Drug Advertising During Baseball: A Concern for Public Health
conservative.body_html: The author and their family are exposed to a significant amount of prescription drug advertisements during the World Series, with these ads often showing individuals who appear healthy engaging in various activities despite having conditions like psoriasis or arthritis. With companies spending $895.8 million on such advertising last year alone within sports programming and FDA regulations allowing risk statements to be included as long as they are clearly stated, there is a concern for public health.

liberal.headline: The Influence of Advertisements on Public Health Awareness During Baseball
liberal.body_html: While watching the World Series and enjoying baseball, the author's family comes across numerous prescription drug advertisements. These ads often show individuals with health conditions like psoriasis or arthritis engaging in various activities despite their issues. With companies investing $895.8 million into such advertising last year alone within sports programming, and the FDA's regulations allowing risk statements to be included as long as they are clearly stated, there is an opportunity for increased public health awareness about these conditions.
